citation.article-title: Novel mycolic acid-containing bacteria in the family Segniliparaceae fam. nov., including the genus Segniliparus gen. nov., with descriptions of Segniliparus rotundus sp. nov. and Segniliparus rugosus sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Segniliparus rotundus sp. nov.
Segniliparus rotundus (ro.tun′dus. L. masc. adj. rotundus rounded, referring to the smooth, round-domed colony forms).
Species has the genus characteristics.
Acid–alcohol-fast rods are uniform in size, 1·0–1·3×0·4 μm.
Colonies are dense, smooth, round and domed on 7H10 and 7H11 agar at 33 °C.
Cells disperse easily in 7H9 broth.
Arylsulfatase activity is weak at 3 days but positive at 14 days.
Growth on LJ or ATS with sodium chloride is negative in 7 days but positive at 14 days.
Growth swirl is negative with MacConkey agar.
Iron uptake is intermediate (tan), does not reduce nitrate or tellurite, Tween opacity is negative or weak and does not grow on lysozyme after 21 days.
Utilizes and produces acid from d-fructose, is variable for glycerol and sucrose and does not use d-mannitol or d-sorbitol.
Susceptible to amikacin, cefoxitin, clarithromycin, ciprofloxacin, doxycycline, imipenem and sulfamethoxazole.
Partially susceptible to tobramycin.
HPLC mycolic acid pattern is a triple cluster of contiguous eluting peaks starting at approx. 6·0 min and ending with the last peak co-eluting with the internal standard.
The DNA G+C content is 68 mol%.
The type strain, CDC 1076T (=ATCC BAA-972T=CIP 108378T), was isolated from human sputum.
An additional strain is CDC 413 (=ATCC BAA-973=CIP 108379).
In addition to the properties described above, the type strain shows the following properties.
Growth occurs in 3–4 days at 28–33 °C on agar medium.
Colonies are clear to white.
Cells grow at the beginning of the spiral on MacConkey agar.
Tween opacity and Tween hydrolysis are weakly positive.
HPLC mycolic acid pattern demonstrates early peaks at 6·03 min and final peak co-eluting at 9·45 min with the high-molecular-mass internal standard.
TLC mycolic acid pattern reveals α+- and α-mycolates.
